Small update:

Corrected dimensions on the TDE thrusters and began adding detail to the bus. I also got the cameras done. Here's a quick update preview with the wip spacecraft logo inspired by the original Viking patch

Nice! hey if anyone is interested in why the landing thrusters look like a shower head - here's why (click the tweet to go to twitter site and read the thread)

 

Edited May 3, 2019 by Drew Kerman

4 hours ago, Drew Kerman said:

Nice! hey if anyone is interested in why the landing thrusters look like a shower head - here's why (click the tweet to go to twitter site and read the thread)

Thank you! Good info on that thread but it's tough to read on that Twitter format.

Spoiler

TL;DR: The 18 Nozzles are designed to distribute the exhaust of the engine to minimize the disturbance of the landing site. By contrast, a craft like the Apollo LEM blew away a lot of dust during landing. Viking needed to keep those particles within reach for science!

Furthermore, while the MR-80 had 18 nozzles, it is still a single engine putting out about 2700 Newtons of thrust. The three MR-80 also interestingly provided the lander's pitch/yaw control via differential thrust. Roll was provided by the tank-mounted RCS system which shared the propellant with the MR-80 engines; 83.9 Kg of Hydrazine. 

 

Edited May 3, 2019 by akron

I often have a issue that some textures are not loading.
There are some erros in the Log like this:

Quote

[ERR 11:54:00.488] Texture 'Coatl Aerospace/ProbesPlus/Assets/mat_stock_N_NRM' not found!

After restart of KSP the textures loads but other parts have no textures. Sometimes everything is OK. it happen randomly and only Probes Plus is affected.

KSP 1.6.1.

6 hours ago, Cheesecake said:

I often have a issue that some textures are not loading.
There are some erros in the Log like this:

After restart of KSP the textures loads but other parts have no textures. Sometimes everything is OK. it happen randomly and only Probes Plus is affected.

KSP 1.6.1.

I have seen this a lot before. As long as Textures Unlimited and/or Firespitter are loading correctly, you can ignore the message. 

It is caused by having a texture reference line in Unity for a texture that no longer exists. Firespitter or TU overwrite Unity's texture assignment anyway so the texture should still load so long as those two are working correctly. I lost track of which parts had the issues and just can't be bothered to fix the texture name typo in Unity since it works fine in-game.

It's been a little bit slow going but trying to keep progress steady. HGA and mast assembly are mostly done. Hoping to not regret all the detail for when the time comes to UV and texture the bloody thing, probably looking at a 2K texture. RTG covers are still just a block-in. Will move on to the LGA S-band and UHF antennae next, along with a bit more deck and bus detail. The RTG/Fuel tank might be next after those, then science parts.

It's starting to look the part, though.

I hate to post tiny bits of progress but I am trying to stay more focused to complete sections, so I figured might as well. Antennas are finished and I took a whack at the RTG covers.

Cool story: Once I did these new RTG covers with somewhat proper dimensions, they ended up wider than the block-in which forced me to shift them a little bit on the Z+ axis so they would not clip into the cameras. Originally I wanted to leave them exactly in the middle for simplicity. Anyway, this more or less lined them up with the real Viking spacecraft which actually had them shifted in Z+ pretty much the same way I had to, except on the real spacecraft it was done to line up the Center of Mass. I must be doing something right.

Will smooth that front curve with maybe some bevels but for now, don't talk to me or my son RTG covers again. These things are a major pain with weird angles and some other BS. Anyone wanna UV unwrap this thing when it's done? I will literally ship you a cookie.

looking great....

cheers.

Why missing? It works with the newest KSP-versions. So you can use this mod.

No worries, I did get back to it but I didn't finish any complete sections so I don't anything fancy to show off. I've been testing the game in 1.7 and then 1.7.1 with the new DLC to see if there's anything Breaking Ground considerations I need to have. Doesn't look that way.

From my testing though, things are wonky and a little incomplete in 1.7.1 modding compatibility-wise. If you're still using ProbesPlus! parts I would suggest staying at 1.6 or 1.7.0 (No DLC) especially if playing career mode.
